Package org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.executor

Class DynamicTaskExecutor<LOCAL>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.internal.batchimport.executor.DynamicTaskExecutor<LOCAL>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, TaskExecutor<LOCAL>, Parallelizable, Panicable
    public class DynamicTaskExecutor<LOCAL>
extends Object
implements TaskExecutor<LOCAL>
    Implementation of TaskExecutor with a maximum queue size and where each processor is a dedicated Thread pulling queued tasks and executing them.

    • Method Detail

      • processors

        public int processors​(int delta)
        Description copied from interface: Parallelizable
        Change number of processors assigned to this Parallelizable. Accepts a delta, which may specify positive or negative value, even zero. This instances may have internal constraints in the number of processors, min or max, which may be assigned and so potentially the change will only be partially accepted or not at all. This is why this call returns the total number of processors this instance now has accepted after any effect of this call. Parallelizable is used in many call stacks where call delegation is predominant and so reducing number of methods to delegate is favored. This is why this method looks and functions like this, it can cater for incrementing, decrementing and even getting number of processors.
        Specified by:
        processors in interface Parallelizable
        Parameters:
        delta - number of processors to add or remove, i.e. negative or positive value. A value of zero will result in merely the current number of assigned processors to be returned.
        Returns:
        the number of assigned processors as a result this call.

      • submit

        public void submit​(Task<LOCAL> task)
        Description copied from interface: TaskExecutor
        Submits a task to be executed by one of the processors in this TaskExecutor. Tasks will be executed in the order of which they arrive.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface TaskExecutor<LOCAL>
        Parameters:
        task - a Runnable defining the task to be executed.

      • assertHealthy

        public void assertHealthy()
        Description copied from interface: TaskExecutor
        Asserts that this TaskExecutor is healthy. Useful to call when deciding to wait on a condition this executor is expected to fulfill.
        Specified by:
        assertHealthy in interface TaskExecutor<LOCAL>
